info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:30PM EDT until September 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CHESTERFIELD...HENRICO AND SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 729 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Tuckahoe to near Highland Springs, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Richmond, Virginia Union University, Mechanicsville, Highland Springs, Tuckahoe, Laurel, Lakeside, East Highland Park, and Glen Allen around 735 PM EDT. Ashland around 745 PM EDT. Randolph Macon College around 750 PM EDT. Studley around 755 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Richmond Heights, Hanover Airport, Elmont, Montrose, Sandston, Longdale, Westwood, Richmond International, Fair Oaks, and Solomons Store. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
